entry.title: Fear of the Deep End
entry.content:
Dedicating yourself towards being extremely good is scary.

Grappling with the shortcomings of your abilities against the demands of what society wants and figuring out how to meet that demand can be daunting.

It's much easier to keep ourselves busy in the safety of the shallows.

entry.title: Progress Formula
entry.content:
Humans make progress by defining a problem and solving it by combining two things: knowledge and action.

Every obstacle towards progress is simply one more problem to solve.

We put a man on the moon because we discovered solutions to a plethora of problems and made the necessary actions to solve them.

entry.title: Define Happiness
entry.content:
Don't guess what makes you happy. Resist the urge to work, work, work and think you'll be happy when you're done.

What's your definition of happiness? Mine is gratitude. The more I am grateful, the more I find myself being happy.

entry.title: The Rule of Five Sentences
entry.content:
There's a new rule that I'd like to apply to my blog. Every article must be five sentences or less. Compound sentences are no exception.

If I cannot summarize my thoughts into five sentences or less, it probably is not worth reading.
